role_based.question: What are the underlying risks associated with performing our work on this project?
role_based.answer:
Based on the discussion, there are a few key risks identified with performing the roofing work on this project:

1. Multiple trades working in the same areas, requiring coordination and safety zones around lifting equipment and work perimeters. As Kevin stated: "there will be a situation with multiple trades in our way. We'll have to coordinate leverage and making sure we've got the safety zone set up around all lifting equipment as soon as the perimeter of our work."

2. Working on wood decks with a lot of torch-applied materials poses a fire safety risk. As Frank mentioned: "to add that, I think you're working on wood deck with a lot of torch, so safety to be watched out for."

3. Working at heights will require proper fall protection and guardrails around roof perimeters. 

4. Cold weather installation may be required starting in October and continuing through winter. This will necessitate using winter-rated products and primers, and cap sheet installation will be limited below certain temperatures. As Dariusz explained: "We'll definitely have some limitations with the cap stripping installation, like the cut-off is zero degree, we'll have to make sure that the customer is aware of that. We'll have to use a winter rated product, so winter rated primers for the SOPRA VAP."

The team will need to proactively mitigate these risks through careful planning, coordination, adherence to safety protocols, and communication with the customer about any weather-related limitations. Reviewing actual site conditions closer to start of work was also recommended to identify any additional risks.
